full_summary:
**Audit of Information Technology (IT) Security (Phase 2)**
**Number of Tender Notification: 202400085**

**Date of Publication: June 23, 2023**
**Tender Closing Date: July 18, 2023 at 2:00 PM**

**Overview of the Requirement**
Public Safety Canada (PSC) is seeking a qualified contractor to provide audit support services for the delivery of an audit of IT security. This requirement is open only to pre-qualified Supply Arrangement Holders who meet the criteria outlined in Stream 3: Information Technology and Systems Audit.

**Scope of Work**
The contractor will collaborate with PSC's Internal Audit and Evaluation Directorate (IAED) to deliver assurance of IT security procedures and infrastructure. The scope of work includes evaluating governance, controls, and risk management practices that support IT security, and identifying gaps and vulnerabilities in the department's IT security program and practices.

**Evaluation Process and Selection Methodology**
The evaluation process will be based on the highest combined rating of technical merit (70%) and price (30%). The detailed evaluation process and methodology are outlined in the Request for Proposal, Part 2.

**Contractual Arrangements**
The contract period will be from the date of contract award to May 31, 2024. As stipulated in the contract, all intellectual property will vest with PSC.

**Security Requirements**
A Secret security clearance is required for the delivery of this project.

**Access to Sensitive Information**
Only pre-qualified Supply Arrangement Holders who meet the criteria outlined in Stream 3: Information Technology and Systems Audit are eligible to participate in this tender.

**Questions and Clarification**
For any questions or clarification regarding this tender, please contact Chantale Gregoire at chantale.gregoire@ps-sp.gc.ca or (343) 549-5220.

**Eligibility Criteria**
Interested bidders must meet the eligibility criteria outlined in Stream 3: Information Technology and Systems Audit.

**Compliance with Trade Agreements**
This tender is open to all entities that are eligible under the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade
